definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
water once spilt cannot be retrieved (idiom); irreversible change

sentences.english: Han Jia, did you see me splashing water just now?
sentences.chinese: 韓佳，剛纔有沒有看到我潑水呀？

sentences.english: Survial from the water-sprinkling festival, there.
sentences.chinese: 因循下來，從此有啦潑水節。

sentences.english: China: Drought Changes Yunnan's Songkran Water Festival .
sentences.chinese: 乾旱致使雲南無法慶祝潑水節。
集體性的相互潑水就這樣開始了。

sentences.english: Local authorities, however, will change the annual festival to reduce water-splashing from one day to 2 hours.
sentences.chinese: 不過，潑水的時間將從以往的1天縮短爲2個小時。

sentences.english: They flirted water to each other's face.
Songkran is the April celebration of the traditional start of Thai new year.
sentences.chinese: 潑水節是每年四月泰國慶祝新年開始的節日。

sentences.english: Water-splashing Festival is the most characteristics festival of the Dai ethnic .
sentences.chinese: 潑水節是傣族最富民族特色的節日。

sentences.english: During the water-splashing festival and row the dragon boat race.
sentences.chinese: 潑水節期間還要進行划龍舟比賽。

sentences.english: I wonder if it's similar to the Water Festival of the Dai people in Yunnan Province.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道它是否與雲南傣族的潑水節相似。

sentences.english: With water repellent styles effect, wear difficult felt Mao, cleaning easy.
sentences.chinese: 具防潑水效果，耐磨不易氈毛，清洗容易。

sentences.english: Sprinkling water means washing off the filth on the body eliminating the disaster and getting happiness.
sentences.chinese: 潑水意味著沖洗掉身上的污垢，消除災難，得到幸福。

sentences.english: The children always puddle about after a rain.
sentences.chinese: 雨後孩子們常在水坑中潑水玩耍。

sentences.english: The day is also cannot go toward outside splashed out the garbage, afraid so poorer.
sentences.chinese: 這一天也不能往外潑水倒垃圾，怕因此破財。

sentences.english: Light weight, quiet keystrokes, dust proof & spill-proof.
sentences.chinese: 重量輕，安靜的按鍵，防塵及防潑水。

to allow in fresh air/to allow a prisoner out for exercise/to give out information
